entry.title: An improved beta v0.2 is now out!
entry.content:
Newer and better! To check it out or install it on your machine, head to ArchLan:Download.

Even though there is still place for improvement, this release is much better and much more usable.

Read this post for more information about this release:

:::note Keep in mind that this release is a beta and I am actively developing

ArchLan
, which means that you might encounter bugs or unexpected errors while using it. The next versions of ArchLan will be even better and I will make sure to listen to users suggestion in order to make ArchLan better! :::

Release notes:

January 2022 (Second Release)

  • Reworked the file structure of a few components
  • Currently remaking the i3 config
  • Branding official wallpapers and window manager configs
  • ArchLan lightdm configuration
  • My own zsh configuration - Undergoing maintenance
  • More...

This beta release provides a perfectly usable environment aimed at any type of user. The next versions will be improved over time.

Latest release:

  • ISO: archlan-2022.01.16-x86_64.iso
  • SIG: archlan-2022.01.16-x86_64.iso.sig
  • SHA: archlan-2022.01.16-x86_64.iso.sha256sum

Verify the authenticity of the ISO

  • Download the
    ISO
    ,
    GPG signature
    and the
    sha256sum
    files
  • Ensure that all the files you have downloaded are present in the same directory as the ISO
  • Verify the key on the keyserver:
$ gpg --recv-keys 5F765E0E531F5B53
  • Verify the iso signature:
$ gpg --verify archlan-2022.01.16-x86_64.iso.sig
  • Then verify the sha256sum:
$ sha256sum -c archlan-2022.01.16-x86_64.iso.sha256sum

entry.title: The first beta release of ArchLan is now out!
entry.content:
The first release of ArchLan is now out! To check it out or install it on your machine, head to ArchLan:Download.

Make sure to know that this release

does not
have a GUI installer yet

Read this post for more information about this release:

:::note Keep in mind that this release is a beta and I am actively developing

ArchLan
, which means that you might encounter bugs or unexpected errors while using it. The next versions of ArchLan will be even better and I will make sure to listen to users suggestion in order to make ArchLan better! :::

Release notes:

January 2022 (First Release)

  • Created from the releng archiso profile, to keep it minimalist
  • Basic i3-gaps and i3blocks config, as I am reworking the ArchLan package repository
  • Branding official wallpapers and window manager configs
  • ArchLan lightdm configuration
  • My own zsh configuration
  • More...

This beta release provides a perfectly usable environment aimed at any type of user. The next versions will be improved over time.
